entry.title: Grayscaleâ€™s 4K Bitcoin Transfer, Blackrock CEO Favorable on Bitcoin, Rippleâ€™s XRP Ousted, and More â€” Week in Review
entry.summary:
Grayscale stirred speculation by transferring 4,000 bitcoins, while Blackrock CEO Larry Fink endorsed bitcoin as â€œdigital gold,â€ surpassing government influence. In regulatory news, Rippleâ€™s XRP was removed from Hong Kong Virtual Asset Consortiumâ€™s top crypto index. Meanwhile, Elon Musk reaffirmed his commitment to Dogecoin, along with revealing that his company Spacex holds a substantial amount of bitcoin.
Grayscaleâ€™s 4,000 Bitcoin Transfer Worth $175M Stirs Speculation
Recent blockchain analytics reveal that 4,000 bitcoins, valued at approximately $175 million, have been transferred from addresses believed to be controlled by Grayscaleâ€™s Bitcoin Trust, commonly referred to as GBTC.
Read More
Blackrock CEO Larry Fink on Bitcoin: Iâ€™m a Big Believer
Larry Fink, the CEO of Blackrock, the worldâ€™s largest asset manager, says he has become â€œa big believerâ€ in bitcoin, emphasizing that it is â€œbigger than any government.â€ Calling the cryptocurrency â€œdigital gold,â€ the executive stressed: â€œUnlike gold, where we manufacture new gold, weâ€™re almost at the ceiling of the most of the amount of bitcoin that could be created.â€
Read More
Rippleâ€™s XRP Ousted From Hong Kong Top Crypto Index
As Hong Kong strengthens its crypto regulatory framework and embraces ETFs, the Hong Kong Virtual Asset Consortium (HKVAC) has updated its top crypto indexes, showing a preference for tokens with market performance and growing industry partnerships.

Elon Musk Still Owns Dogecoin â€” Spacex Owns Bitcoin
Tesla CEO and Spacex chief Elon Musk has revealed that he still owns â€œa bunch of dogecoin,â€ affirming his commitment to keep buying and supporting the meme cryptocurrency. Musk additionally revealed that his company Spacex still owns â€œa bunch of bitcoin.â€

entry.title: Bitcoin Booms: Hash Rate Records Shattered, Bullish Signal Unleashed

entry.title: L2 Protocol Manta Network Suffers DDoS Attack, Project Leaders Face Money Laundering Allegations
entry.summary:
Manta Network, a modular layer two (L2) protocol, said a distributed denial-of-service attack on Jan. 18 resulted in the network accumulating a large queue of recent transactions. The attack, which occurred during a token-issuing event, is believed to have severely limited communication between the protocol and Manta Network apps.
An Aggressive and Timed Attack
On Jan. 18, the Manta Network, a modular layer two (L2) protocol, announced that it was a victim of a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack. The attack resulted in a sharp increase in the number of pending transactions. According to Kenny Li, who shared the DDoS attack alert via X (formerly), the attack initially saw 135 million requests hitting remote procedure call (RPC) nodes, proving that â€œa very aggressive and timed â€¦

entry.title: FTX Under New Scrutiny: Appellate Court Orders Independent Investigation

entry.title: 'Look Touch Own': OONA Discusses Her Performance Art Exhibition
entry.summary: Conceptual artist OONA joins moderator Raina Marie to discuss "Look Touch Own," her performance art exhibition featuring her own former breast implants, which have been tokenized. This conversation was recorded at Rug Radio's R Haus event at Art Basel Miami in December 2023.

entry.title: Genius Marketing by Genius Marketers: How Crypto Builders Can Reach the Masses
entry.summary: Rug Radio founder Farokh Sarmad moderates a conversation between 9dcc founder and CEO Gmoney and Serotonin founder and CEO Amanda Cassatt about the challenges and opportunities in Web3 marketing and how they're navigating the ever-evolving space. Recorded at Rug Radio's R Haus event at Art Basel Miami in December 2023.

entry.title: Generative Art Across Mediums: Artists Discuss the Evolving Space
entry.summary: In this panel discussion from Rug Radio's R Haus at Art Basel Miami 2023, Sofia Garcia, Ismail Tazi, Emily Edelman, and Aleksandra Art discuss the expanding generative art spaceâ€”and why "generative" doesn't necessarily have to mean digital.

entry.title: The AI Coin to Rule Them All with Mike Grantis
entry.summary: Reza is joined by Mike Grantis from Contango Digital to discuss - The AI coin to rule them all - The Solana Ecosystem - What's next for Solana airdrops

entry.title: Conversation With Snowfro: Bringing 'Chromie Squiggle' #8107 to the Physical Space
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO and "Chromie Squiggle" project creator Erick "snowfro" Calderon spoke with Benny Redbeard Gross at Rug Radio's R Haus event at Art Basel 2023, to discuss how and why "Chromie Squiggle" NFT #8107 was given a special edition print run in collaboration with Avant Arte.

entry.title: Don't Underestimate Mobile Gaming: Qualcomm's Matthew Grossman
entry.summary: Qualcomm product marketing manager Matthew Grossman tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin why mobile esports is exploding in popularity around the worldâ€”and dispels some of the misconceptions around mobile gaming.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF: This Is the 'Calm Before the Storm', Says ETF Analyst
entry.summary: Bloomberg Senior ETF Analyst Eric Balchunas joins Farokh Sarmad, Michael Anderson, and Ovie Faruq on the FOMO Hour to share the latest intel on the looming approval for a spot Bitcoin ETF, what might happen when the very different worlds of TradFi and crypto collide, and his insights on â€œGenslish,â€ the unique and strategic language of SEC chair Gary Gensler.

entry.title: Losing 1500 BTC on Mt Gox and the Problem with Women in Web3
entry.summary:
This week our host is joined by Brooke Lacey!
They discuss: - Making and losing generational wealth - Trauma Bond - Women in Web3 - The Problem with WAGMI

entry.title: ESL Faceit Group Exploring Blockchain 'Opportunistically,' Says Exec
entry.summary: Sam Braithwaiteâ€”ESL Faceit Group's VP of Game Ecosystems, Mobile, and Snapdragon Pro Seriesâ€”shares the esports firm's approach to blockchain technology with GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Bryan Johnson Explains His Quest for Immortality and Why He Started with the Penis
entry.summary: Billionaire biohacker Bryan Johnson shared with Decrypt's Jason Nelson why he began his longevity quest and how technology has shaped the endeavor. Johnson also discusses some of his controversial experiments.
